docs.title: Related Sessions at Cisco Live
docs.text: • BRKXXX-1111 My friend's breakout session

docs.title: Go Beyond! and challenge yourself
docs.text:
Your trial is capable to configure Customer Assist Queues! Customer Assist Queues have additional features:

  • Agent and Supervisor Experience in the Webex app, upgrade Eric Steele, Anita Perez and Charles Holland license to Customer Assist.
  • Create a new Queue, but now Customer Assist: Services-> Customer Assist->Queues->Add Queues-> add www.webex.com as the screen pop. The wizard of creation its almos the same. Add Charles as supervisor, Anita and Eric as agents in the queue. Assign a number to the Queue. Customize your queue as you like.
  • Login as Choland in the webex app, in a different device, like your mobile phone or a different computer you can login as Eric. Test the Agent and Supervisor Customer Assist experience. Monitor Eric as a supervisor in the webex app. Need help? Webex Help Article

docs.title: Survey
docs.text:
Please make sure to take the survey:

Passcode: WebexCallingLab

docs.title: Lab
docs.text:
LAB–1251

Leveling up communication: A follow-along Webex Calling lab​

This hands-on lab provides experience in Webex Calling. Complete practical exercises such as configuring local gateways, using features, and managing call routing through Webex Control Hub. Learn to handle calls efficiently, explore mid-call functions, and understand call flow management in a simulated environment. The lab enhances skills in managing communication systems and optimizes telephony infrastructure for improved organizational communication.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
Lab Guide: Getting started [4](#lab-guide-getting-started)

Customer Scenario [4](#customer-scenario)

Lab 1 – Organization Settings [5](#lab-1-organization-settings)

Lab 2 – Location Settings [6](#lab-2-location-settings)

Lab 3 – Users [9](#lab-3-users)

Lab 4 – Devices [11](#lab-4-devices)

Lab 5 – Workspaces [12](#lab-5-workspaces)

Lab 6 – Virtual and shared lines [14](#lab-6-virtual-and-shared-lines)

Lab 7 – Configuring Calling features [15](#lab-7-configuring-calling-features)

Lab 8 – Creating Call Queues [19](#lab-8-creating-call-queues)

Lab 9 – Admin-controlled user features [21](#lab-9-admin-controlled-user-features)

Lab 10 – Configurations in User Hub [22](#lab-10-configurations-in-user-hub)

docs.title: Lab Guide: Getting started
docs.text:
This guide is structured into multiple labs, each focusing on a specific aspect of Webex Calling configuration. To successfully complete the exercises:

  • Follow Steps Sequentially

  • Numbered steps must be followed precisely

  • If a setting in Control Hub is not listed in the task instructions, leave default settings or skip

  • Access URLs and Login

  • Use specified URLs (e.g., `admin.webex.com`) for portals

  • Instructor-provided login credentials

  • Ensure correct login for each task

  • Green text = Online navigation for the portal in use

  • End of each lab section marked by "STOP – END OF LAB”

  • Wait for further instruction before moving forward

docs.title: Customer Scenario
docs.text: This lab guide provides step-by-step instructions for configuring Webex Calling to meet the business needs of our fictional customer, Paw Pet Supply Solutions, who are new to the platform.

docs.title: Company Profile
docs.text:
• Paw Pet Supply Solutions is an emerging leader in the pet supply industry

  • Provides high-quality, innovative products for pet care

  • Committed to animal well-being and customer satisfaction

  • Aims to be a trusted partner for pet parents

docs.title: Setup and Requirements
docs.text:
• Locations: HQ in California, Factory in Texas

  • Communication Platform: Webex Calling with Cisco Calling Plan as PSTN solution

  • Departments: Marketing, Sales, Product Development

  • Numbers: Main number for Sales, Auto Attendant for Marketing and Product Development

  • Business Hours: 9 am – 5 pm, voicemail after hours

  • Sales Department Specifics: Call pickup, call hold for department members, company-wide announcements

  • Product Development Specifics: User-controlled voicemail routing

  • Shared Resources: Shared Cubicles at HQ, Conference rooms with Room Board devices and phones, all employees use MPP phones.

  • Pre-configured Environment: Foundational elements already created for streamlined experience:

  • One location: “dCloud”, to be renamed

  • Eight users: one administrator, seven standard users.

  • All users require Webex Calling licenses

docs.title: Lab 1 – Organization Settings
docs.text:
In this lab, you will learn how to navigate and configure organization settings for Webex Calling.

URL: admin.webex.com Login: Instructor provided credentials: Charles Holland – Webex Administrator

1. Services-> Calling-> Service settings-> Internal dialing-> Edit

All location extensions are mirror images of each other

Enable an internal dialing plan at the organization level

  • Routing prefix length: 2

  • Steering digit: 8

  • Extension length: 3

2. Services-> Calling-> Service settings-> Voicemail

A default passcode is required for new voicemail users

Set a default voicemail passcode for all users in the organization

  • Default Passcode: 258011

3. Services-> Calling-> Service settings-> Call Recording

Webex is the preferred calling vendor

Set Webex as the call recording provider

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab 2 – Location Settings
docs.text:
In this lab, you will learn how to add locations.

URL: admin.webex.com Login: Instructor provided credentials: Charles Holland – Webex Administrator

1. Management-> Locations-> dCloud-> Location info

San Jose is the headquarters and main location

Rename dCloud location

  • Location name: HQ

2. Management-> Locations-> Manage location-> Create manually

Paw Pet Solutions has a factory in Houston, TX.

Add a location

  • Location name: Factory

  • Address: 4501 North Main Street, Houston, TX 77009, USA

  • Time zone: Chicago

  • Country – USA

  • Language – English

  • Click “Set up calling” after creating your location and then close the PSTN connection window.

    • You will set up the PSTN connection in another step

3. Management-> Locations-> Select location-> Calling-> PSTN connection

HQ and Factory will use the Cisco Calling Plan

Assign a PSTN Connection to each location

  • Location: HQ

  • Connection Type: Cisco Calling Plans

  • Contract Information: Your name, Student login email address

  • Services Address: HQ location address (already entered)

  • Authorized Contact: Your name

  • Job title: Admin

    Repeat steps for Factory location

4. Services-> Calling-> Numbers-> Manage-> Add

Each location needs 10 numbers

Add Numbers

  • Location: HQ

  • Number Type: PSTN

  • Select an Area Code from the list

  • Select 10 numbers

  • Click view orders

  • Click on the pending order to automatically change the status to provisioned

    Repeat steps for Factory location

5. Management-> Locations-> Select location -> Calling-> Calling Connection-> Main number

To make and receive calls each location needs a main number. Each location must present their own main number as their caller id.

Assign a main number to each location

  • Select any of the available numbers

  • You will need to know these numbers in a subsequent lab; make a note of which ones you use

6. Management-> Locations-> Select location -> Calling-> Dialing-> Internal dialing

All location extensions are mirror images of each other.

Add a routing prefix for each location

  • HQ: 81

  • Factory: 82

7. Management-> Locations-> Select location -> Calling-> Calling feature settings-> Voice portal

All locations need voicemail.

Configure the voice portal for each location

  • Extension: 200

  • Voice Portal Admin Passcode: 137041

  • Language: English

8. Management-> Locations-> Select location -> Calling-> Calling feature settings-> Schedules

Calls coming into the main numbers need to route to specific options based on the time of day.

Create a schedule for both locations

  • Name: Open Hours

  • Schedule Type: Business Hours

  • Monday – Friday 9:00 am – 5 pm

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab 3 – Users
docs.text:
In this lab, you will learn how to create users, assign licenses, and assign extensions to users manually and in bulk.

URL: admin.webex.com Login: Instructor provided credentials: Charles Holland – Webex Administrator

1. Management-> Users-> select user

Anita Perez needs a phone number and to use calling features.

Assign Anita a Calling license and assign a phone number

  • License: Webex Calling Professional

  • Location: HQ

  • Number: Unused number (not main number of the Location)

  • Extension: 101

2. Management-> Users-> Manage users-> Add users-> Manually add users OR CSV add or edit

There are 16 employees that require extensions for calling.

  • Use instructor provided Add Users and Devices Template file or tables below

    • YourFullName = Your first and last name

    • ## = Instructor provided student number

  • Create users for each location manually and/or in bulk

  • Assign a Webex Calling professional license and an extension number

HQ User Emails Extensions License Charles Holland 102 Professional Eric Steele 103 Professional Kellie Melby 104 Professional Sales1@YourFullName##.com 105 Professional Sales2@YourFullName##.com 106 Professional Marketing1@YourFullName##.com 107 Professional Marketing2@YourFullName##.com 108 Professional Factory User Emails Extensions License Ricardo Filice 101 Professional Stefan Mauk 102 Professional Taylor Bard 103 Professional Rebekah Barretta 104 Professional ProductDev1@YourFullName##.com 105 Professional ProductDev 2@YourFullName##.com 106 Professional ProductDev 3@YourFullName##.com 107 Professional ProductDev 4@YourFullName##.com 108 Professional

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab 4 – Devices
docs.text:
In this lab, learn how to assign devices to users.

URL: admin.webex.com Login: Instructor provided credentials: Charles Holland – Webex Administrator

1. Devices-> Add device-> Personal Usage OR Multiple Cisco IP Phones

All users have a Cisco 8800 series phone

  • Use instructor provided Add Users and Devices Template file or tables below

    • Assign devices to users manually or in bulk

  • Activation method: Activation Code

  • Do not include extension numbers in the CSV file

  • Type: USER

  • Device Type: IP

  • Model: Cisco 8865

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab 5 – Workspaces
docs.text:
In this lab, you will learn how to create workspaces, assign devices to workspaces, and enable hoteling and hotdesking on workspace devices.

URL: admin.webex.com Login: Instructor provided credentials: Charles Holland – Webex Administrator

1. Management-> Workspaces-> Add Workspace

Paw Pet Supply Solutions has 4 shared use areas in which they need to hold meetings and make and receive calls

  • Add the workspaces with the corresponding devices and services

Workspace name Type Device Services Location Extension SharedCubicle1 Desk Cisco Desk Phone - 9841

Cisco Webex Calling

Common area workspace

HQ 201 SharedCubicle2 Desk Cisco 8865

Cisco Webex Calling

Common area workspace

HQ 201 Conference Room1 Meeting Room Cisco Board Pro Cisco Webex Calling Professional workspace HQ 300 Cisco 8865 Conference Room1 Meeting Room Cisco Board Pro Cisco Webex Calling Professional workspace Factory 300 Cisco 8865 2. Management-> Workspaces-> Select Workspace-> Scheduling

To conduct calls in private, users may sometimes need to access all of their configured lines from a location other than their usual desk.

Enable Hot Desking

  • Workspace: SharedCubicle1

  • Hot Desking: Enable

3 Management-> Devices-> Select device-> Hoteling

To conduct calls in private, users may sometimes need to make and receive calls in a space other than their typical desk. Most of these users only have a primary line.

Enable device to be used as a hoteling host

  • Device: Cisco 8865 belonging to SharedCubicle2

  • Hoteling: Enable

  • Limit the time a guest can use this phone to 12 hours

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab 6 – Virtual and shared lines
docs.text:
Learn how to create virtual lines and assign them as shared line appearances.

URL: admin.webex.com Login: Instructor provided credentials: Charles Holland – Webex Administrator

1. Services-> Calling-> Virtual Lines

Eric Steele and Kellie Melby require a Houston phone number for calling customers in the Houston area

Create two virtual lines

  • Names: Extra Line1 and Extra Line2

  • Location: Factory

  • Assign a spare phone number and extension 110 and 111

2. Management-> Devices-> Select device-> Device Management -> Configure Lines

Eric Steele and Kellie will need to access those lines on their 8800 series Cisco multi-platform phones

Assign virtual lines from the step above to the appropriate devices

STOP

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab 7 – Configuring Calling features
docs.text:
In this lab, you will learn how to create virtual extensions, call park extensions, and call park groups.

URL: admin.webex.com Login: Instructor provided credentials: Charles Holland – Webex Administrator

1. Services-> Calling-> Features-> Call park extension-> Create call park extension

The sales department needs to place callers on hold for team members to pick them up from any device

Create call park extensions

  • Location: HQ

  • Names & Extensions:

    • Extension 1 – 401

    • Extension 2 – 402

    • Extension 3 – 403

2. Services-> Calling-> Features-> Call park group-> Select location-> Create call park group

Create a call park group

  • Location: HQ

  • Name: Sales CP Group

  • Members:

    • Kellie Melby

    • Sales1@YourFullName##.com

    • Sales2@YourFullName##.com

  • Park Destinations: Call Park Extensions 401, 402, 403

    • Recall: Alert Parking User Only

3. Services-> Calling-> Features-> Call pickup-> Create call pickup

The Sales Department employees need to answer each other calls when other team members in the same location are unavailable.

Create Pickup Group

  • Location: HQ

  • Name: SalesCPick

  • Users:

    • Kellie Melby

    • Sales1@YourFullName##.com

    • Sales2@YourFullName##.com

4. Services-> Calling-> Features-> Paging group-> Create paging group

Anita Perez needs to quickly make important announcements to all employees.

Create a paging group

  • Location: HQ

  • Name: Announcements Page

  • Extension: 501

  • Caller ID: Announcements Page

  • Paging Targets: All employees

  • Paging Originators: Anita Perez

5 Services-> Calling-> Features ->Voicemail group-> Create voicemail group

After hours calls need to route to a voice mailbox that all employees in the Sales and Marketing departments can access

Create a voicemail group

  • Location: HQ

  • Name: AfterHours VmailGroup

  • Extension: 600

  • Passcode: 258011

  • Language: English

6 Services-> Calling-> Features-> Operating Mode

Rebekah Barretta needs to route calls to voicemail for the Product Development department as needed. For example, if the office closes unexpectedly or there is a company-wide meeting.

Create an operating mode

  • Level: Organization

  • Name: ToVmail

  • Forward destination: Ext 600 (AfterHours VmailGroup)

7 Services-> Calling-> Features-> Hunt group-> Manage -> Add

During business hours, the employees in Marketing and Product Development departments need to share the volume of incoming calls

Create a hunt group for Marketing

  • Location: HQ

  • Name: Marketing HG

  • Extensions: 701

  • Routing: Circular

  • Routing Options: Advance when busy

  • Assign all Marketing employees and Eric Steele

    Create a hunt group for Product Development

  • Location: Factory

  • Name: ProductDev HG

  • Extensions: 701

  • Routing: Circular

  • Routing Options: Advance when busy

  • Assign all Marketing employees and Eric Steele

  • Call Forwarding: Enable

    • Forward calls by mode

    • Add ToVmail operating mode

8 Services-> Calling-> Features-> Announcements-> Manage-> Add File -> Upload

The company needs to let callers know that certain calls are recorded.

Upload a greeting to be used for specific features

  • Location: Organization

  • Label: Calls will be Recorded

  • Filename: All-Calls-are-Recorded.wav, file provided by instructor

9 Services-> Calling-> Features-> Announcements-> Manage-> Add File -> Record

The company wants callers to hear messages periodically while they are on hold for certain calls.

Record and save a greeting to be used for specific features

  • Location: Organization

  • Label: Waiting

  • Filename: Answer Soon

  • Message: “Your call is important to us. We will be with you shortly”

10 Services-> Calling-> Features-> Auto attendant-> Create auto attendant

Calls to the Factory main number must be answered by an automated system giving callers the options to reach their desired department with different options for business and after hours

Create an auto attendant for the Factory main number

  • Location: Factory

  • Name: AA Main

  • Number: Factory Main Number

  • Extension: 250

  • Language: English

  • Schedule: Open Hours

  • Holiday Schedule: None

  • Business Hours Menu

    • Disable extension level dialing

    • Option 1:

      • Transfer without prompt: Marketing HG

    • Option 2:

      • Transfer without prompt: Product Development HG

    • Option 3: Repeat Menu

    • Option 4: Transfer call to operator – Anita Perez

  • After Hours Menu

    • Option 1: Transfer call to operator – AfterHours VmailGroup ext 600

    • Custom Welcome Greeting: Record and rename file to welcome.wav

    • Custom Closed Greeting: Record and rename file to closed.wav

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab 8 – Creating Call Queues
docs.text:
In this lab, you will learn how to create call queues.

URL: admin.webex.com Login: Instructor provided credentials: Charles Holland – Webex Administrator

1. Services-> Calling-> Features-> Call Queue-> Manage -> Add

During business hours, callers to the San Jose Support and Sales departments should be placed on hold until an agent is available.

Create a Call Queue

  • Location: HQ

  • Name: Sales Queue

  • Extension: 900

  • Number of calls in queue: 15

  • Caller ID: Location number

  • Routing: Priority Based - Longest Idle

  • Overflow: Transfer to Anita Perez after 60 seconds

  • Welcome Message: Mandatory

    • Custom Welcome Message: Call Recorded, instructor provided

  • Comfort Message: 20 seconds between messages

    • Custom Comfort Message: Answer Soon, instructor provided

  • Hold Music: Play default music

  • Agents:

    • Sales1@YourFullName##.com

    • Sales2@YourFullName##.com

    • Eric Steele

    • Kellie Melby

  • Enable Night Service:

    • Default Greeting

    • Transfer to Phone number 600

    • Open Hours schedule

  • Stranded calls: Follow Night Service

2. Services-> Calling-> Features-> Call queue-> Supervisors-> Add Supervisor

The supervisor needs to silently monitor agents in their respective queues

  • Supervisor: Charles Holland

  • Agents:

    • Sales1@YourFullName##.com

    • Sales2@YourFullName##.com

    • Eric Steele

    • Kellie Melby

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab 9 – Admin-controlled user features
docs.text:
In this lab, you will learn to configure admin-controlled user features.

URL: admin.webex.com Login: Instructor provided credentials: Charles Holland – Webex Administrator

1. Management-> Users-> Rebekah Barretta-> Calling-> Calling handling -> Mode management

Rebekah Barretta needs to change the Product Development HQ to ToVmail operating mode as needed

Enable mode management for Rebekah Barretta

  • Add Product Development HQ

    Make note of Rebekah’s email address for the next lab!

2. Management-> Users-> Anita Perez-> Calling-> Between-user permissions-> Monitoring

Anita Perez requires the ability to monitor the lines all sales employees

Add monitored lines to Anita Perez’s profile

  • Users:

    • Sales1@YourFullName##.com

    • Sales2@YourFullName##.com

    • Eric Steele

    • Kellie Melby

3. Management-> Users-> Anita Perez-> Calling-> Between-user permissions -> Hotdesking

Anita Perez needs to use a line with a Houston phone number (virtual line created in Lab 6) when using the Hotdesking feature

Add virtual line to Anita Perez’s profile

  • Add: Extra Line1

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab 10 – Configurations in User Hub
docs.text:
In this lab, you will learn how users can configure calling settings in User Hub.

URL: user.webex.com

Login: Rebekah Barretta’s email, password same as your admin login (Charles Holland)

1. user.webex.com-> Settings -> Calling -> Features -> Mode Management

Rebekah Barretta needs to route calls to voicemail for the Product Development department as needed. For example, if the office closes unexpectedly or there is a company-wide meeting.

Manage call-forwarding settings in User Hub

  • Select Product Development HG

    • Switch Mode

      • ToVmail

    • Switch back

2. user.webex.com -> Settings -> Calling -> Hoteling

Rebekah Barretta sometimes needs to use a phone at the San Jose location as her own when she visits

Enable hoteling for Rebekah Barretta

  • Hoteling: SharedCubicle2

STOP - END OF LAB

Congratulations!

You have completed:

LAB-1251

Leveling up communication:

A follow-along Webex Calling lab

docs.title: Lab 1 - Organization Settings
docs.text:
In this lab, you will learn how to navigate and configure organization settings for Webex Calling.

  • Paw Pet Supply Solutions desire their telephone system configured in a certain way:

    • Control Hub Configuration easy, with a longer timeout
    • Extensions with the XX-XXX format, with mirrored extensions
    • Default passcode for voicemail
    • Call Recording with Webex

docs.title: Login Credentials
docs.text:
URL

admin.webex.com

Login

Charles Holland – Webex Administrator

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1.

Management-> Organization Settings-> Control Hub Idle Timeout

You do not want to be logged out of Control Hub every 20 minutes

  • Change the timeout to 12 hours

Webex Help Article

2.

Services-> Calling-> Settings-> Service-> Internal dialing-> Edit

All location extensions are mirror images of each other

Enable an internal dialing plan at the organization level

  • Routing prefix length: 2

  • Steering digit: 8

  • Extension length: 3

Webex Help Article

3.

Services-> Calling-> Settings-> Service-> Voicemail

A default passcode is required for new voicemail users

Set a default voicemail passcode for all users in the organization

  • Default Passcode: 258011

Webex Help Article

4.

Services-> Calling-> Settings-> Service-> Call Recording

Webex is the preferred calling vendor

Set Webex as the call recording provider

Webex Help Article

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab 2 - Location Settings
docs.text:
In this lab, you will learn how to add locations.

  • Paw Pet Supply Solutions desire their telephone system configured in a certain way:

    • There is 2 locations: HQ and Factory
    • Cisco Calling Plan is used as PSTN for both locations
    • 10 numbers ordered for each location
    • Prefixes for the extension will be: HQ 81 and Factory 82
    • Open Hours defined per location to be used for users, and calling features

docs.title: Login Credentials
docs.text:
URL

admin.webex.com

Login

Charles Holland – Webex Administrator

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1.

Management-> Locations-> dCloud-> Location info

San Jose is the headquarters and main location

Rename dCloud location

  • Location name: HQ

Webex Help Article

2.

Management-> Locations-> Manage locations-> Create manually

Paw Pet Solutions has a factory in Houston, TX.

Add a location

  • Location name: Factory

  • Address: 4501 North Main Street, Houston, TX 77009, USA

  • Time zone: Chicago

  • Country – USA

  • Language – English

In your new Factory location go to Calling and click “Set up calling” after creating your location and then close the PSTN connection window, on Cancel, or the x button.You will set up the PSTN connection in another step

Webex Help Article

3.

Management-> Locations-> Select location-> PSTN->PSTN Configuration->PSTN connection->Manage

HQ and Factory will use the Cisco Calling Plan

Assign a PSTN Connection to each location

  • Location: HQ

  • Connection Type: Cisco Calling Plans

  • Contract Information: Your name, Student login email address

  • Services Address: HQ location address (already entered)

  • Authorized Contact: Your name

  • Job title: Admin

  • Click on done (add numbers later)

Repeat steps for Factory location

Webex Help Article

4.

Services-> PSTN & Routing-> Numbers-> Add numbers

Each location needs 10 numbers

Order and add Numbers

  • Location: HQ

  • Number Type: PSTN

  • Select an Area Code from the list

  • Order 10 numbers

  • Click view orders

  • Click on the pending order to automatically change the status to provisioned

Repeat steps for Factory location

Webex Help Article

5.

Management-> Locations-> Select location -> PSTN-> PSTN Configuration-> Main number

To make and receive calls each location needs a main number. Each location must present their own main number as their caller id.

Assign a main number to HQ and Factory locations

  • Select any of the available numbers

You will need to know your locations main number in a subsequent lab; make a note of which ones you use.

Webex Help Article

6.

Management-> Locations-> Select location -> Calling-> Dialing-> Internal dialing

All location extensions are mirror images of each other.

Add a routing prefix for each location

  • HQ: 81

  • Factory: 82

Webex Help Article

7.

Management-> Locations-> Select location -> Calling-> Calling features settings-> Voice portal

All locations need voicemail.

Configure the voice portal for each location

  • Incoming Call:Extension 200

  • Voice Portal Admin Passcode: 137041

  • Language: English

Repeat steps for Factory location

Webex Help Article

8.

Management-> Locations-> Select location -> Calling-> Calling features settings-> Schedules

Calls coming into the main numbers need to route to specific options based on the time of day.

Create a schedule for HQ and Factory locations

  • Name: Open Hours

  • Schedule Type: Business Hours

  • Monday – Friday 9:00 am – 5 pm

Webex Help Article

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab 3 - Users
docs.text:
In this lab, you will learn how to create users, assign licenses, and assign extensions to users manually and in bulk.

  • Paw Pet Supply Solutions desire their telephone system configured in a certain way:

    • 16 users with webex calling professional license distributed in both locations

docs.title: Login Credentials
docs.text:
URL

admin.webex.com

Login

Charles Holland – Webex Administrator

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1.

Management-> Users-> select Anita Perez

Anita Perez needs a phone number and to use calling features.

Assign Anita a Calling license and assign a phone number

  • License: Webex Calling Professional

  • Location: HQ

  • Number: Unused number (not main number of the Location)

  • Extension: 101

Webex Help Article

2.

Management-> Users-> Add users OR Add users dropdown -> Manage users by CSV

there are 16 employees that require extensions for calling.

  • Use instructor provided Add Users and Devices Template to modify the csv template file or manually create users based on tables below. Keep in mind that existing users also need Webex Calling professional license as well as location and extension settings.

    • YourFullName = Your first and last name

    • ## = Instructor provided student number

  • Create users for each location manually and/or in bulk

  • Assign a Webex Calling professional license and an extension number

Webex Help Article

Using the Add Users and Devices Template and import csv file

First download the existing user list, Go to Management->Users->Add users dropdown->Manage users by CSV and click on "Generate a new CSV" button. Under Export Status, look for Results and the Download link. In the downloaed file, remove Anita Perez row, this file will be your user csv template to import. Copy paste all existing users email addresses of the user csv file, and paste them in your AddUsersTemplate excel file. Edit "YourFullName##" to your name and student number. Copy the columns from the template, and paste them in your downloaded user file. Save with a different name, and verify the extension and format is csv. Don't modify the first row of your user csv template. Import csv file.

HQ User Emails Extensions License Charles Holland 102 Professional Eric Steele 103 Professional Kellie Melby 104 Professional Sales1@YourFullName##.com 105 Professional Sales2@YourFullName##.com 106 Professional Marketing1@YourFullName##.com 107 Professional Marketing2@YourFullName##.com 108 Professional Factory User Emails Extensions License Ricardo Filice 101 Professional Stefan Mauk 102 Professional Taylor Bard 103 Professional Rebekah Barretta 104 Professional ProductDev1@YourFullName##.com 105 Professional ProductDev2@YourFullName##.com 106 Professional ProductDev3@YourFullName##.com 107 Professional ProductDev4@YourFullName##.com 108 Professional

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab 4 - Devices
docs.text:
In this lab, learn how to assign devices to users.

  • Paw Pet Supply Solutions desire their telephone system configured in a certain way:

    • All users wants to have an MPP phone, and will be activated through activation codes

docs.title: Login Credentials
docs.text:
URL

admin.webex.com

Login

Charles Holland – Webex Administrator

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1.

Devices-> Add device-> Personal Usage

Anita Perez needs a 9861 phone

Assign devices to users manually or in bulk

  • Activation method: Activation Code

  • Model: Cisco 9861 (it's the fancy phone on your desk!)

  • Enter the activation code

Webex Help Article

2.

Devices-> Add device-> Multiple Cisco IP Phones

The rest of the users have a Cisco 8800 series phone

    Use the "Add device sample template" from Control Hub to bulk add devices to the users.

  • Download "Add device sample template"

  • Download "Users in my organization"

  • Copy all email adresses except for Anita Perez. Get Username from the "Users in my organization" template.

  • Use the "Add device sample template" to assign devices to users in bulk. Fill only the indicated columns, leave the rest blank.

    • Username: Paste email adresses

    • Type: USER

    • Device Type: IP

    • Model: Cisco 8865

  • Upload the modified device sample template, scroll down and select Provide link, before submit the file

  • When the job finish, download the activation code list

Webex Help Article

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab 5 - Workspaces
docs.text:
In this lab, you will learn how to create workspaces, assign devices to workspaces, and enable hoteling and hotdesking on workspace devices.

  • Paw Pet Supply Solutions desire their telephone system configured in a certain way:

    • There is 4 areas that need devices:
    • 2 Share Cubicle areas that can be booked by any user, with Cisco 8865 MPP phones.
    • One Meeting room per location, that need a Cisco Room device, and may need to install MPP phones in the future.

docs.title: Login Credentials
docs.text:
URL

admin.webex.com

Login

Charles Holland – Webex Administrator

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1.

Management-> Workspaces-> Add Workspace

Paw Pet Supply Solutions has 4 shared use areas in which they need to hold meetings and make and receive calls

Add the workspaces with the corresponding devices and services. Devices will be added using activation code.

Workspace name Type Location Device Services Extension SharedCubicle1 Desk HQ Cisco Managed Device: Cisco 8865

Cisco Webex Calling

Common area workspace

201 SharedCubicle2 Desk HQ Cisco Managed Device: Cisco 88xx or 78xx (in your desk! activate it)

Cisco Webex Calling

Common area workspace

202 Conference Room1 Meeting Room HQ Cisco Room and Desk device Cisco Webex Calling Professional workspace 300 Conference Room2 Meeting Room Factory Cisco Room and Desk device Cisco Webex Calling Professional workspace 300

Webex Help Article

2.

Management-> Workspaces-> SharedCubicle1-> Scheduling

To conduct calls in private, users may sometimes need to access all of their configured lines from a location other than their usual desk.

Verify that Hot Desk Sign in is selected

Webex Help Article

3.

Management-> Workspaces-> SharedCubicle2-> Scheduling

To enable hoteling, its needed to disable hot desking for the Workspace.

Disable Hot Desk Sign in

Webex Help Article

4.

Management-> Devices-> SharedCubicle2> Hoteling

To conduct calls in private, users may sometimes need to make and receive calls in a space other than their typical desk. Most of these users only have a primary line.

Enable device to be used as a hoteling host

  • Device: Cisco 8865 belonging to SharedCubicle2

  • Hoteling: Enable

  • Limit the time a guest can use this phone to 12 hours

Webex Help Article

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab 6 - Virtual and shared lines
docs.text:
Learn how to create virtual lines and assign them as shared line appearances.

  • Paw Pet Supply Solutions desire their telephone system configured in a certain way:

    • Eric and Kelly need to call and receive calls from a number from a different location.

docs.title: Login Credentials
docs.text:
URL

admin.webex.com

Login

Charles Holland – Webex Administrator

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1.

Services-> Calling-> Virtual Lines

Eric Steele and Kellie Melby need virtual Houston phone lines to call Houston-based customers, enabling them to maintain a local presence, despite being based in California (HQ).

Create two virtual lines

  • Names: Houston Cust Line1 and Houston Cust Line2

  • Location: Factory

  • Assign a spare phone number and extension 110 and 111

Webex Help Article

2.

Services-> Calling-> Virtual Lines-> Select Virtual Line-> Devices-> Assign Device

Eric Steele and Kellie will need to access to the Houston Customer Line from their Cisco 8865 MPP phones

  • Assign Eric's Cisco 8865 device to the virtual lines Houston Cust Line1

  • Assign Kellie's Cisco 8865 device to the virtual lines Houston Cust Line2

Webex Help Article

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab 7 - Configuring Calling features
docs.text:
In this lab, you will learn how to create virtual extensions, call park extensions, and call park groups.

  • Paw Pet Supply Solutions desire their telephone system configured in a certain way:

    • Call Park Group configured with call park extensions
    • Call Pickup
    • A way to bring anouncements with a Paging Group
    • After Hours Voicemail Group
    • A way for Rebekah to route the calls to the Product Development department to voicemail at will
    • Marketing and Product Development departments need their own extension
    • Factory main number routed to an IVR

docs.title: Login Credentials
docs.text:
URL

admin.webex.com

Login

Charles Holland – Webex Administrator

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1.

Services-> Calling-> Features-> Call park extension-> Add New

The sales department needs to place callers on hold for team members to pick them up from any device without tying up their personal extensions.

Create call park extensions

  • Location: HQ

  • Names & Extensions:

    • Extension 1 – 401

    • Extension 2 – 402

    • Extension 3 – 403

Webex Help Article

2.

Services-> Calling-> Features-> Call park group-> Add New

Create a call park group

  • Location: HQ

  • Name: Sales CP Group

  • Members:

    • Kellie Melby

    • Sales1@YourFullName##.com

    • Sales2@YourFullName##.com

  • Park Destinations: Call Park Extensions 401, 402, 403

    • Recall: Alert Parking User Only

Webex Help Article

3.

Services-> Calling-> Features-> Call pickup-> Add New

the Sales Department employees need to answer each other calls when other team members in the same location are unavailable.

Create Pickup Group

  • Location: HQ

  • Name: SalesCPick

  • Users:

    • Kellie Melby

    • Sales1@YourFullName##.com

    • Sales2@YourFullName##.com

Webex Help Article

4.

Services-> Calling-> Features-> Paging group-> Add New

Anita Perez needs to quickly make important announcements to all employees.

Create a paging group

  • Location: HQ

  • Name: Announcements Page

  • Extension: 501

  • Paging Targets: All employees

  • Paging Originators: Anita Perez

Webex Help Article

5.

Services-> Calling-> Features ->Voicemail group-> Add New

After hours calls need to route to a voice mailbox that all employees in the Sales and Marketing departments can access

Create a voicemail group

  • Location: HQ

  • Name: AfterHours VmailGroup

  • Extension: 600

  • Passcode: 258011

  • Language: English

  • Do not make changes to Voicemail Settings

Webex Help Article

6.

Services-> Calling-> Features-> Operating Mode-> Add New

Rebekah Barretta needs to route Product Development calls to voicemail during events like unexpected office closures or company-wide meetings.

Create an operating mode

  • Level: Organization

  • Name: ToMode

  • Schedule: None

  • Forward destination: Ext 600 (AfterHours VmailGroup)

Webex Help Article

7.

Services-> Calling-> Features-> Hunt group-> Add New

During business hours, Marketing employees need to share the incoming call volume within their groups. Create a hunt group for Marketing

  • Location: HQ

  • Name: Marketing HG

  • Extensions: 701

  • Routing: Longest idle

  • Routing Options: Advance when busy

  • Assign all Marketing employees and Eric Steele

During business hours Product Development employees need to share the incoming call volume within their groups. Create a hunt group for Product Development. Rebekah Barretta needs to activate Operation mode to route calls to voicemail during events like unexpected office closures or company-wide meetings.

  • Location: Factory

  • Name: ProductDev HG

  • Extensions: 701

  • Routing: Circular

  • Routing Options: Advance when busy

  • Assign all ProductDev employees and Rebeka Barretta

  • Create HG

  • Open HG and open Call Forwarding

    • Call Forwarding: Enable

    • Forward calls by mode

    • Add ToMode operating mode

Webex Help Article

8.

Services-> Calling-> Features-> Announcements-> Add New

The company needs to let callers know that certain calls are recorded.

Upload a greeting to be used for specific features

  • Upload

  • Location: Organization

  • Label: All Calls are Recorded

  • Download All-Calls-are-Recorded.wav

  • Upload: All-Calls-are-Recorded.wav

The company wants callers to hear messages periodically while they are on hold for certain calls.

Record and save a greeting to be used for specific features

  • Record

  • Location: Organization

  • Label: Waiting

  • Filename: Answer Soon

  • Message: “Your call is important to us. We will be with you shortly”

Webex Help Article

9.

Services-> Calling-> Features-> Auto attendant-> Add New

Calls to the Factory main number must be answered by an automated system giving callers the options to reach their desired department with different options for business and after hours

Create an auto attendant for the Factory main number

  • Location: Factory

  • Name: AA Main

  • Phone Number: Factory Main Number (taken from Lab02)

  • Extension: 250

  • Language: English

  • Business Hours Schedule: Open Hours

  • Holiday Schedule: None

  • Business Hours Menu

    • Disable extension level dialing

    • Option 1:Transfer without prompt:Extension 81-701 (Marketing HG)

    • Option 2:Transfer without prompt: Extension 82-701 (Product Development Factory)

    • Option 3: Repeat Menu

    • Option 4: Transfer call to operator – Extension 81-101 (Anita Perez)

  • After Hours Menu

    • Option 1: Transfer call to operator – Extension 81-600 (VmailGroup)

  • Business Hours Greetings

    • Custom Welcome Greeting: Record and rename file to welcome.wav

  • After Hours Greetings

    • Custom Closed Greeting: Record and rename file to closed.wav

Webex Help Article

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab 8 - Creating Call Queues
docs.text:
In this lab, you will learn how to create call queues.

  • Paw Pet Supply Solutions desire their telephone system configured in a certain way:

    • HQ main number routed to a Sales Queue, with welcome message, confort message and music on hold.
    • This number at night is routed to the After Hours Voicemail Group
    • When there is more than 15 callers inside the queue, route calls to the voicemail group
    • If all agents are not available, or unreachable send calls to Voicemail Group
    • Charles Holland may need to supervise agents

docs.title: Login Credentials
docs.text:
URL

admin.webex.com

Login

Charles Holland – Webex Administrator

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1.

Services-> Calling-> Features-> Call Queue-> Add New

During business hours, callers to the San Jose Support and Sales departments should be placed on hold until an agent is available.

Create a Call Queue

  • Location: HQ

  • Name: Sales Queue

  • Phone Number: HQ Main Number (taken from Lab02)

  • Extension: 900

  • Number of calls in queue: 15

  • External caller ID phone number: Location number

  • Routing: Priority Based - Longest Idle

  • Overflow Settings:

    • Transfer to phone number: Extension 81-600 AfterHours VmailGroup

    • Enable over flow after 60 seconds

  • Welcome Message:

    • Welcome Message is mandatory: Enabled

    • Custom Welcome Message: All-Calls-are-Recorded.wav

  • Comfort Message: Enabled

    • Time between comfort message: 10 seconds

    • Custom Comfort Message: Default Greeting

  • Hold Music: Enabled

    • Hold Music: Play default music

  • Agents:

    • Sales1@YourFullName##.com

    • Sales2@YourFullName##.com

    • Eric Steele

    • Kellie Melby

  • Create Queue

  • Select Queue

  • Go to Queue Policies, select Night Service

    • Enable Night Service:

    • Transfer to Phone number: Extension 81-600 (VmailGroup)

    • Default Greeting

    • Business Hours: Open Hours schedule

  • Go to Queue Policies, select Stranded Calls

    • Triger policy when all agents are unreachable: enabled

    • Night Service: selected

Webex Help Article

2.

Services-> Calling-> Features-> Call queue->Supervisors-> Add Supervisor

The supervisor needs to silently monitor agents in their respective queues

  • Supervisor: Charles Holland

  • Agents:

    • Sales1@YourFullName##.com

    • Sales2@YourFullName##.com

    • Eric Steele

    • Kellie Melby

Webex Help Article

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab 9 - Admin-controlled user features
docs.text:
In this lab, you will learn to configure admin-controlled user features.

  • Paw Pet Supply Solutions desire their telephone system configured in a certain way:

    • Rebekah needs to activate the operation mode in the Product Development HG
    • Anita monitor Eric, Kellie and Sales users.
    • Anita when booking using Hotdesking need a number from the Factory Location

docs.title: Login Credentials
docs.text:
URL

admin.webex.com

Login

Charles Holland – Webex Administrator

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1.

Management-> Users-> Rebekah Barretta-> Calling-> Calling handling -> Mode management

Rebekah Barretta needs access to change the Product Development Hunt Group’s operating mode to ensure calls are properly routed when all agents are unexpectedly unavailable.

Enable mode management for Rebekah Barretta

  • Add Product Development HG

    Take note of Rebekah’s email address for the next lab!

Webex Help Article

2.

Management-> Users-> Anita Perez-> Calling-> Between-user permissions-> Monitoring

Anita Perez needs to quickly identify and answer calls on monitored lines to improve response times and customer service

Add monitored lines to Anita Perez’s profile

  • Users:

    • Sales1@YourFullName##.com

    • Sales2@YourFullName##.com

    • Eric Steele

    • Kellie Melby

Webex Help Article

3.

Management-> Users-> Anita Perez-> Calling-> Between-user permissions -> Hotdesking

Anita Perez needs the Houston virtual phone number added to her Hotdesking profile to appear local to Houston clients while working at a temporary desk

  • Add: Houston Cust Line1

Webex Help Article

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab 10 – Configurations in User Hub
docs.text:
In this lab, you will learn how users can configure calling settings in User Hub.

  • Paw Pet Supply Solutions desire their telephone system configured in a certain way:

    • Rebekah wants to activate the Operation mode
    • Rebekah wants to book the SharedCublicle2 phone.

docs.title: Login Credentials
docs.text:
URL (use INCOGNITO mode in your browser)

user.webex.com

Login

Rebekah Barretta

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1.

user.webex.com-> Settings -> Calling -> Features -> Mode Management

Rebekah Barretta needs to route calls to voicemail for the Product Development department as needed. For example, if the office closes unexpectedly or there is a company-wide meeting.

Manage call-forwarding settings in User Hub

  • Select Product Development HG

    • Switch Mode

      • ToVmail

    • Switch back

      • Click on the name of the HG

      • Revert to normal

      • Cancel and revert to standard

Webex Help Article

2.

user.webex.com -> Settings -> Calling -> Call Settings -> Hoteling

Rebekah Barretta sometimes needs to use a phone at the San Jose location as her own when she visits

Enable hoteling for Rebekah Barretta

  • Hoteling: SharedCubicle2

Webex Help Article

STOP - END OF LAB

docs.title: Lab Guide: Getting started
docs.text:
This guide is structured into multiple labs, each focusing on a specific aspect of Webex Calling configuration. To successfully complete the exercises:

  • Follow Steps Sequentially

    • Numbered steps must be followed precisely
    • If a setting in Control Hub is not listed in the task instructions, leave default settings or skip

  • Access URLs and Login

    • Download Presentation
    • Use specified URLs (e.g., admin.webex.com) for portals
    • Download the Login Credential file, you will be asigned a student number
    • All users in your organization have the same password
    • Ensure correct login for each task
    • Join Webex Space for LAB-1251

  • End of each lab section marked by "STOP – END OF LAB”

    • Wait for further instruction before moving forward

docs.title: Customer Scenario
docs.text:
This lab guide provides step-by-step instructions for configuring Webex Calling to meet the business needs of our fictional customer, Paw Pet Supply Solutions, who are new to the platform.

Company Profile: Paw Pet Supply Solutions

  • Paw Pet Supply Solutions is an emerging leader in the pet supply industry.
  • Provides high-quality, innovative products for pet care.
  • Committed to animal well-being and customer satisfaction.
  • Aims to be a trusted partner for pet parents.

docs.title: Setup and Requirements
docs.text:
• Locations: HQ in California, Factory in Texas
  • Communication Platform: Webex Calling with Cisco Calling Plan as PSTN solution
  • Departments: Marketing, Sales, Product Development
  • Numbers: Main number for Sales, Auto Attendant for Marketing and Product Development
  • Business Hours: 9 am – 5 pm, voicemail after hours
  • Sales Department Specifics: Call pickup, call hold for department members, company-wide announcements
  • Product Development Specifics: User-controlled voicemail routing
  • Shared Resources: Shared Cubicles at HQ, Conference rooms with Room Board devices and phones, all employees use MPP phones.
  • Pre-configured Environment: Foundational elements already created for streamlined experience:
  • One location: “dCloud”, to be renamed
  • Eight users: one administrator, seven standard users.
  • All users require Webex Calling licenses

docs.title: Disclaimer
docs.text: Although the lab design and configuration examples could be used as a reference, for design related questions please contact your representative at Cisco, or a Cisco partner.

docs.title: Lab Access
docs.text:
Use your browser to access Control Hub admin.webex.com as well as the User Portal user.webex.com

  • Login Credential file
  • Use your student number to locate your admin user
  • All users in your organization have the same password

docs.title: Adding a Copy Button Without a Code Block
docs.text:
This will copy the following text: <copy>Text to copy</copy>

This will copy the following text: Text to copy

docs.title: Adding user specific variables into your lab guide
docs.text: There may be times in which you want to embed some attendee specific information into the instructions of your lab guide, like credentials or phone numbers, which will be used on multiple pages of your lab guide. You can gather the information via a form or you can pass a pre-encoded JSON string as a URL parameter to populate the variable values into the browser's session storage. Then you can use a simple HTML tag with a special class name to update the values in the lab guide. This feature can be combined with the copy button method above.

docs.title: Form Method
URL Method
docs.text:
If you have a lot of attendee variables in your lab, you may choose to precompile and encode them so that you can simply provide a URL link which will load all of their required information.

To see this in action, add this string at the end of the URL for any page on this site: ?eyJBZG1pbiI6ImFkbWluQHh5ei5iaXoiLCJQVyI6InNVcGVyU2VjcmV0MTIzISIsIkVQIjoiRVAxIiwiRE4iOiIrMTkxMDU1NTEyMTUyIiwiUXVldWUiOiJRdWV1ZTEiLCJRdWV1ZTIiOiJRdWV1ZTIiLCJUZWFtIjoiVGVhbTEiLCJUZWFtMiI6IlRlYW0yIn0=

docs.title: Initial Setup
docs.text: This lab guide template uses MKDocs to take your markdown documentation and transform it into an interactive web based lab guide. You will need to install some software on your PC or Mac in order to take full advantage of the tool which will allow you to view your changes as you save them and ensure that your formatting is exactly how you want it.

docs.title: Prerequisite Software to Install
docs.text:
1. Python
  2. Visual Studio Code
  3. Git

docs.title: Setting up your lab guide on your computer
Clone your repository with git
docs.text:
Open Visual Studio Code

Click the Source Control button in the left menu

Click Clone Repository

Enter the repository source: https://github.com/WebexCC-SA/LAB-1251.git

Select or create a new folder to clone the repository into.

docs.title: Build the environment
docs.text:
When prompted to open the cloned repository, select open.

Drag open the terminal at the bottom of the Visual Studio Code window

Show Me

If you are on a PCIf you are on a Mac

In your terminal enter the following commands:

python -m venv venv

Set-ExecutionPolicy -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Scope CurrentUser

venv\Scripts\activate.ps1

pip install -r requirements.txt

mkdocs serve

Open a browser to http://127.0.0.1:8000

In your terminal enter the following commands:

python -m venv venv

source venv/bin/activate

pip install -r requirements.txt

mkdocs serve

Open a browser to http://127.0.0.1:8000

docs.title: Using the tool after the initial setup
Using the tool after the initial setup
docs.text:
After the initial setup you will only need to take the following steps:

Open Visual Studio Code

Click the Source Control button in the left menu

Click Open Folder and navigate to the folder where you cloned the repository

If you are on a PCIf you are on a Mac

In your terminal enter the following commands:

venv\Scripts\activate.ps1

mkdocs serve

Open a browser to http://127.0.0.1:8000

In your terminal enter the following commands:

source venv/bin/activate

mkdocs serve

Open a browser to http://127.0.0.1:8000

docs.title: MK Docs Feature Reference:
docs.text: https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/reference/

docs.title: Markdown Cheat Sheets:
docs.text:
https://www.markdownguide.org/cheat-sheet/

https://github.com/lifeparticle/Markdown-Cheatsheet

docs.title: Publishing Your Changes
docs.text: As you progress with the creation of your lab guide, you should sync your changes periodically to GitHub.

docs.title: Syncing your changes to GitHub
docs.text:
Make sure that you have saved all of the files you want to sync up to the repository

Click the Source Control button in the left menu

Click the plus sign next to each file you want to sync as you hover over the file names or alternatively, click the plus sign next to changes

Enter a note about the changes you are making in the message text box

Click the down chevron on the commit button to reveal more options

Select Commit & Sync

docs.title: After you Sync your changes, it will take a few minutes for GitHub Actions to build the website so that you can view all of the changes you made.
